Description: The Tribulations of St Antony; the saint is in mid-air, tormented by demons. c.1469-73 Engraving; the sheet is in bad condition and has been made up in pen and ink
Curator's comments: Stogdon notes that impressions of the first state of this print are watermarked with paper used 1469-73 (see Hollstein Introduction). A similar impression of this print was issued as a black and white facsimile by the British Museum in 'Prints and Drawings in the British Museum, Reproduced by Photographic Process', [First Series] Part III (German Prints), Published by the Trustees in 1884, where it was number XXVII and described there as 'Martin Schongauer. About 1470 - 1488.'; (Shelfmark 245*.b.14). The lettering along the bottom edge of the print was reversed to read 'M S &'.
Bibliographic references: Hollstein / German engravings, etchings and woodcuts c.1400-1700 (54.II)
Lehrs 1908-34 / Geschichte und kritische Katalog des deutschen, niederländischen und französischen Kupferstichs im XV Jahrhundert (V.243.54.II)
Associated names: Representation of: St Antony of Egypt
